intent: Reorganized docs to prioritize AI agent integration, added Cursor section
reasoning_trace:
Restructured the docs page to better reflect Lore's primary use case with AI coding assistants.

Changes made:
1. Moved AI Agent Integration section up to appear right after the Features comparison table
2. Added a dedicated Claude Code Integration section with step-by-step setup instructions
3. Added a new Cursor Integration section with:
   - Instructions to create .cursorrules file
   - Alternative method using Cursor Settings > Rules for AI
4. Moved Installation section below the integration sections
5. Renamed 'Quick Start' to 'Manual Usage' and moved it lower in the page
6. Renamed 'Commands' to 'Commands Reference' and moved it to the bottom
7. Updated navigation: replaced 'Usage' link with 'Integration' link
8. Changed hero CTA button to point to #integration instead of #installation

Rationale:
- Most users will integrate Lore with AI coding assistants (Claude Code, Cursor, etc.)
- The integration sections should be prominent and easy to find
- Manual CLI usage is secondary and can be discovered after understanding the main use case
- Installation is a prerequisite but not the first thing users need to understand

The page flow is now: Why Lore exists → How to integrate with your AI assistant → How to install → Manual usage reference

rejected_alternatives.name: Keeping original section order - integration was buried too far down the page
Separate pages for each integration - decided single page with clear sections is better for discoverability
